str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Fitting season, season, opportunity, occasion, time. Of uncertain affinity; an occasion, i.e. Set or proper time.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From pleres; to make replete, i.e. to cram, level up, or to furnish, satisfy, execute, finish, verify, etc.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From basileus; properly, royalty, i.e. rule, or a realm.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Trans: I bring near; intrans: I come near, approach. From eggus; to make near, i.e. approach.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: From meta and noieo; to think differently or afterwards, i.e. Reconsider.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: From pistis; to have faith, i.e. Credit; by implication, to entrust.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From the same as euaggelizo; a good message, i.e. The gospel.
